data.title: CONTENTdm
data.meta_description: President Theodore Roosevelt standing in a carriage in Richmond, Virginia. In the carriage, from left to right, are Andrew Jackson Montague, Governor of Virginia, Carlton McCarthy, Mayor of Richmond, William Loeb, Jr., Presidential Secretary, and President Theodore Roosevelt. On October 18, 1905, President Theodore Roosevelt made several speeches in Richmond, Virginia, including one at the Capital Square. Source: Almanac of Theodore Roosevelt, http://www.theodore-roosevelt.com/images/research/txtspeeches/149.txt
